chinese: 老耿端起枪，眯缝起一只三角眼，一搂扳机响了枪，冰雹般的金麻雀劈哩啪啦往下落，铁砂子在柳枝间飞迸着，嚓嚓有声。
english: Old Geng picked up his shotgun, squinted, and pulled the trigger. Two sparrows crashed to the ground like hailstones as shotgun pellets tore noisily through the branches.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Old Teng raised his gun and looked up at a pair of triangular eyes, cocking the trigger and the shot rang out, like thunderclaps as if it were raining down from the sky. The bullets flew across the branches of the trees like cannonballs, cracking and clinking with a loud sound.

Old Geng raised his rifle, squinted his eyes, and fired. A crisp sound erupted when the rifle barrel clicked shut, sending crumpling peas splashing through the air, shards of metal shooting through the branches, like shattered sandstones.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Old耿拿起枪，眯着眼睛一搂扳机就响了枪，金麻雀噼里啪啦的往下掉，铁砂子在柳枝间飞溅，发出“嚓嚓”的声音。

Old Geng raised his pistol, squinted, and fired: bang! The shooting sprays of goldbird shot swept down toward him, while streaks of red-hot ironseed began flying through the air between the willows and splatting noisily to the ground.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The English translation of your sentence is: "Old Tung holds a gun, his eyes shut tightly, and the trigger sounds as he fires a bullet. A deafening thunderclap shakes the trees down below. The stones fly around like hailstones in the fields."

chinese: 次日天未明时，刘老老便起来梳洗了， 又将板儿教了几句话； 五六岁的孩子，听见带了他进城逛去，喜欢的无不应承。
english: Next day Grannie Liu was up before dawn. As soon as she had washed and done her hair, she set about teaching Ban-er a few words to say to the ladies at the great house – an exercise to which he submitted cheerfully enough, as would any little boy of four or five who had been promised an outing to the great city.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The next day at dawn, Liu Geowon got up early and washed himself. He also taught him some more words. Five-year-old children heard he was going to go to the city and like to follow him.

Three or four hours before this, Grannie Liu had risen early and awoke Qing-er on purpose for an inspection of the rising sun; and using no less than forty or fifty servants to carry out her directions, all of them had been given just as much as they could handle.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: At dawn the next day, Liu Langlang got up to brush her teeth, then taught boarder a few sentences; five or six year old children like him liked his company when he was taken to the city for a tour.

But by some miracle of preparation, Grannie Liu rose sometime before daybreak and proceeded to groom herself with care. She instructed Ban-er in a few words of the language of the city and, making him promise his simple assent to all these assertions, brought him out with her to go shopping.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: On the second day after dawn, Liu Geong woke up at a certain time in the morning, and taught him some words on his board; he had five-year-olds who heard him come out of town and liked him very much.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: But not till very early in the day did she rise up and begin to brush her hair, to recite the utterances she had been given to her by Her Grandson before they set off for work, and to promise to return them our promises on their visit; and when she returned to her room she made no distinction whatever between boys and girls who were to be taken in with her to the city; and it was with delight that the little girl departed with him to their new home.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The next morning, Liu Lao got up early and washed himself. He taught him a few words as well. A five or six year old boy, hearing he was taken with his father to go to town, would say yes without thinking.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: When he awoke, at about daybreak, she had already been up for some time and was now dressing herself and telling Ban-er a few things or two. A five-year-old child could answer quite a lot by heart and being taken along with his grandmother to go out in the country and visit friends was enough to enchant him.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The next day, after dawn, Liu Geong woke up at three o'clock in the morning. He got dressed and taught a few words to his son. The six-year-old children heard him taking him to the city, and he accepted it gladly.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): First thing that made him up and go out of his bed was Grannie Liu's directions for him; he was required to repeat them to the chamberlain when he went out again. An eight or nine-year-old girl with a good memory responded without shame to her teacher's instructions.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: At dawn on the second day, Liu Laolao got up and washed his face. He also taught him a few words. A five or six year old boy likes going out with his father.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But she didn't begin to wake her again until the sun was high in the sky. When she did awaken her, she gave him a good dressing and tutted over his little phrases until he agreed to nothing but the simplest tasks.

chinese: 钱老板道：“是，是，多谢香主。” 在一张椅上坐了，续道：“属下将小郡主藏在猪肚里带进宫来，一来是为瞒过宫门侍卫的重重搜检，二来是要瞒过沐王府众人的耳目。
english: 'Thank you, Master,' said Butcher Qian, seating himself in one of the chairs and continuing. 'There were really two reasons why I hid the Little Countessinside this pig's carcass. One was to get her past the Palace Guard: they always search everyone at the gate. But it was also to get her past any of the Mu Family spies who might be out watching for us.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Money, do you say? Yes, I am grateful." The money man sat down on a chair. He continued his speech, "The underling has been hidden in the pig's belly in the palace and brought in as a prisoner, so that it will hide behind the eyes of the guards in the palace and the ears of the people in the royal family.

Any more, sir,' said the butcher. He sat down on a chair and began his account. 'At any rate,' he added after a silence, 'to summarize everything I told you before: first of all I concealed this little princess in one of the pig's feathers and inside him was the room by hiding it among other chickens in the palace; secondly, I wanted to hide my family from the guards at the gate and the people within the Palace so that they couldn't discover our secret.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Boss Qian said, "Yes, yes, thank you." He sat on a chair and continued, "I brought my little princess into the palace through the belly of a pig. One reason is to avoid being searched by the palace guards; another reason is to avoid arousing suspicion among the沐王府众人."

Of course,' said Butcher Qian eagerly. He sat himself down in a chair and continued: 'I took the Little Countess to live in my pigs' belly when I came here from the Palace. First of all it was to avoid being searched by the Palace guards; but mainly so that I could keep it from people like the Mu Family.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Money said: "Yes, yes, thank you for your kindness." He sat on a chair and continued: "I have been sent by my superior to hide his little lady in the pig's belly, so that I can deceive the guards of the palace, and also deceive the people who come to the Chu Family.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: If you wish to thank him, he is,' said Butcher Qian, seated on one of the salient chairs. 'He was afraid you might追问原来的情况，所以将郡主装在这只猪肚子里面溜进皇宫来。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Mr. Yang said, "Yes, yes, thank you very much." He sat on a chair and continued, "My lord sent me here because he wanted to hide the princess in her stomach. One reason was to avoid the palace guards' thorough searches; the other was to keep their ears open from my lord's men."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Yes,' said Butcher Qian. 'We're glad if they have gone.' He sat himself down in a chair again and continued: 'We hid her in one of the pig's bellies and brought her into the Palace. One thing was to avoid being searched by the Palace guards; and the other was to avoid arousing the attention of the Mu folk.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Money said: "Yes, yes, thank you." He sat down on a chair and continued, "I will send the lady of the house under the pig stomach to the palace to hide her in, one is to deceive the guards who search the palace gate, and two is to deceive the people of the palace.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Well, well, well,' said Butcher Qian on the chair as he sat down at a table: 'if you will take the trouble to continue your account, I think I know enough about it to tell you everything that occurs in my presence. First of all, I concealed this little gem in the pig's belly inside my sash, so that when the Gate-of-Douglas men try to check it up again tomorrow morning, they shall find it missing; and secondly, I hope to trick their intelligence by disguising my踪影在这儿。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Boss Quan said, "Yes, yes, thank you very much." He sat on a chair and continued, "My lord sent me here because he wanted to hide the young lady in the stomach of a pig. The first reason is to avoid the search by palace guards. The second reason is to prevent the ears of Lord Mou from being disturbed."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Yes,' said Butcher Qian. 'We're all grateful to you, Master. We'd used a similar plan with our other two girls, but they were much younger; and it was to avoid giving away the location of our hold that I took her secretly here.

chinese: 但已经晚了，物理学家静静地躺在地上，半睁的双眼看着从他的头颅上流出的血迹，疯狂的会场瞬间陷入了一片死寂。
english: But it was already too late. The physicist lay quietly on the ground, his eyes still open as blood oozed from his head. The frenzied crowd sank into silence.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: But it is too late. Physicists lie still on their feet, half opened eyes watching the blood that pours from his head, a dead zone instantly envelops the stage.

But already too late: the physicist lay peacefully on the floor, his eyes open only half-opened; the blood that flowed down his head filled the space left by his ears, and the crowd became a complete death march.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: But it was too late. Physicists lay quietly on the ground, half-opened eyes looking at the bloodstains flowing from his head, the crazy assembly suddenly plunged into a dead silence.

But it was too late. The physicist was already dead. He had lifted one of his eyes from the floor, stared at the bloodstains flowing from his skull, and died. The frantic convention hall had fallen into silence.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: But it is too late. The physicist lay on the ground half open-eyed as his head was dripping with blood. A dead silence enveloped the room suddenly.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: But already too late: the physicist lay peacefully on the ground, his eyes open only half-opened, studying the blood flowing out of his head. In a single burst of madness, the attendance room became completely dead.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: But it was too late. Physicists lay quietly on the ground with half-opened eyes as blood oozed from his head, the frenzied conference instantly plunged into a dead silence.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: But it was too late. The physicist lay motionless on the floor, half open. His eyes followed the blood-soaked dots of blood spilling from his skull, until the chaotic convention hall entered into a state of absolute silence.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: But it was too late. Physicists lie quietly on the ground, half open eyes watching the bloody trail that his head had left behind. The chaos of the conference suddenly plunged into a dead silence.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But already too late: the physicist was dead, sprawled on the ground, his eyes open only half-opened, and staring at the blood draining from his head. The rally群声沮丧的沉默立刻成了无声的终结。

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But it was too late. The physicist lay dead on the floor, half open eyes observing the bloodstained fabric. The frenzied crowd had fallen into silence after seeing to their own needs.

english: But then Shao did something that no one expected. She married a persecuted high-level cadre from the Education Ministry. At that time, the cadre still lived in a 'cowshed' for reform through labor.

english: 'If you can find any shortcomings in Cousin Bao-chai', said Xiang-yun, 'you must be very good indeed.'

chinese: 海老公问起今日做了什么事，韦小宝说了到鳌拜家中抄家，至于吞没珍宝、金银、匕首等事，自然绝口不提，最后道：“太后命我到鳌拜家里拿两部《四十二章经》……”
english: When Old Hai asked what he had been doing that day, Trinket told him that he had been helping supervise the confiscation of Oboi's estate. He concluded his account—which of course omitted any mention of the dagger and various other valuables that he had pocketed for himself—by telling him about the two copies of the Sutra in Forty-Two Sections that had been discovered in Oboi's house.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Mr. Hai asked what he had done today, and Wang Xiaobo said that he had taken everything from the house of the Ruler. There was no need for him to say anything about stealing treasure, gold, etc., and finally replied, "The Empress has sent me two copies of the Four Twenty-Seven Chapters of the Buddha."

The old eunuch asked what he had done that day. Trinket answered him that he had taken the family首饰一宗,一口铜钱和一些银子,以及一把匕首。 他说完这些话，就不答下人到鳌拜家拿经书之类的事情。 "That Lady Wen wants me to take two volumes of the Four-Times Chapter Book . . .. '"

Finally, he said: "Empress Dowager ordered me to get two copies of the Fourty-two Chapters from the house of Abao."

The old eunuch had started a discussion of recent events, starting with today's visit to Oboi's place and ending with some expletives about the precious metals and gems he'd been told had been taken from Oboi's palace. In his final statement that he'd been sent by the Empress Dowager to fetch two copies of the Sutra in Two Parts from Obao's place . . .'

The only thing that came out was that Trinket had gone to Oboi's house to take the two parts of the Sutra that had been passed onto the Empress Dowager as a gift. 'I've been sent to take the two parts of the Sutra that came with Oboi's wife when I saw Her Ladyship today,' he said finally.

chinese: 夫妻二人半世只生此女，一旦失去，何等烦恼，因此昼夜啼哭，几乎不顾性命。 看看一月，士隐已先得病，夫人封氏也因思女构疾，日日请医问卦。
english: The shock of so sudden a loss to a middle-aged couple who had only ever had the one daughter can be imagined. In tears every day and most of the night, they almost lost the will to go on living, and after about a month like this first Shi-yin and then his wife fell ill, so that doctors and diviners were in daily attendance on them.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Half a century ago, they had a daughter. But now if this becomes their only child, what kind of trouble would it cause? So every day they weep for her in the morning and at night, even disregarding their lives. Look at one month, Master Su’ang is already ill with illness, and Miss Fang also has thought of bringing her to see a doctor and consult her.

In these early days before their marriage her offspring had just been born. At the time the present balance of life was岌岌有危，然而自此至今日夜不停不止的哭诉，一直到了士隐不在了之后，女儿已经名正言顺、寄胎在府上；至于妻母何者可忍, 而如何能令二老受苦? 他们每日夜班地去请大夫作诊，家中的琐事也都全权由庶子带路去说理。

They would weep day and night, almost losing their lives. After a month, Mr. Xing was already ill, and Lady Shen also became sick because of thinking about her daughter.

The husband and wife had now reached their middle twenties and were still the rightful owners of a little girl; the thought of parting with her at any stage caused them such sorrow that they were weeping for almost every day. The older of these months was so young that it was already apparent to those looking after him that he was seriously ill. The younger was so ill that his wife fell ill too, because she could not bear the sight of the two of them grieving for their lost child.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Half a century ago, they had two children together. When one of them died, it was very troublesome for her. The Lady of Shunwei also caused the illness by thinking that her daughter was sick, daily asking doctors and reading the卦象。
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Living together for so many years, both parents had brought their children into the world; then, too, too soon, as the child grew older, this female child of theirs disappeared. chinese: 没有比流言更能胡编乱造，信口雌黄的了。
english: No one is better at making up stories, telling lies, and wagging its tongue than gossip.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: There is no other form of fabrication than lies and wild speculation. It's as if you were speaking from the wind.
No word of reporting was more base, or even reasonable, than flippant and nonsensical.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: There is no more deceitful than spreading rumors.
To invent a scandalous tale would be more difficult than making up true facts.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: There is no better way to fabricate than to say something half-baked. Just as a windmill has two blades, so too do we have two voices that can be used to create nonsense.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: No other kind of fabrication was more嚣张妄造、凭空而来的了。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: There's no better way of fabricating lies than by spreading rumors.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Gossip is more than enough material for make-believe; crockery without brains will invent whatever comes into its head to fill it up.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: There is no more fluff than a rumor, with the word "I" being used instead of the word "it".
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): No other kind of fabrication was more嚣张诡谲了，你只要讲一句，天翻地覆的神话就应运而至。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: There is no better way to make up lies than by spreading them around.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): There is none worse than gossip in cranking out whole stories and myths without thought.

chinese: 虽然我奶奶与他已经在高粱地里凤凰和谐，在那个半是痛苦半是幸福的庄严过程中，我奶奶虽然也怀上了我的功罪参半但毕竟是高密东北乡一代风流的父亲，但那时奶奶是单家的明媒正娶的媳妇，爷爷与她总归是桑间濮上之合，带着相当程度的随意性偶然性不稳定性，况且我父亲也没落土，所以，写到那时候的事，我还是称呼他余占鳌更为准确。
english: Even though by then he and Grandma had already done the phoenix dance in the sorghum field, and even though, in the solemn course of suffering and joy, she had conceived my father, whose life was a mixture of achievements and sin (in the final analysis, he gained distinction among his generation of citizens of Northeast Gaomi Township), she had nonetheless been legally married into the Shan family. So she and Granddad were adulterers, their relationship marked by measures of spontaneity, chance, and uncertainty. And since Father wasn't born while they were together, accuracy demands that I refer to Granddad as Yu Zhan'ao in writing about this period.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Although my grandmother is also a harmonious couple with him on his side of the rice field, and in that solemn and solemn period where they were both sorrowful and happy together, I do not have any charge, but it was indeed a proud father of the highland East of the Northern Plains, but then it was just a single man's marriage ceremony as a wedding partner, and there was quite a degree of randomness and instability. Moreover, I did not come from soil yet, so I called him "Luo Xue Qing" more accurately when writing about the things at that time.

Even though my grandma had already been blossoming in the sorghum fields under the direction of her father, who was a single man from Northeast Gaomi Township, where she was a married man who at once shared pain with me and at the same time compensated Granddad for his crime, she still held a certain elegance and refined refinement in those highland northeast villages where, when the soil rested on her head, she was a married wife who, having been adopted, felt at once relief and annoyance toward my grandfather. Also, despite the fact that he hadn't born any children, by which time it was already possible to call him Cousin Amtu more appropriately.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Although my grandmother had been harmoniously married with him in the field of corn, she was still happily pregnant at that time, but despite her being a half-dirty, half-fortunate father, I should call her a single house wife who was engaged in marriage by the family. My grandfather had been married to her as well, so it was not very stable or fixed, and even though my father hadn’t fallen off the earth yet, I shouldn’t use his name.

Even though Grandma had consummated her love for Yu Cang in the sorghum field, reaching harmony and happiness, she remained a half-crazed, half-cursed child born of a father who walked among the gourd fields of Northeast Gaomi Township — a man who, like his father before him, had been tied to his wife and loved unconditionally. But Grandma was not a virgin; she had not fallen into debt to society. So, even when it came time to write about this period in her life, I called her by the name of her father, Yu Cang.

Furthermore, I did not descend from the earth, so when writing about those things at that time, I called him "Rema Quan" more accurately.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Although Grandma had consummated her love for him in the sorghum field, she had not completed the sin-and-cleansing equation; so I grew half-evil, half-happy. Before Granddad, his moral compass disturbed by this sudden beauty and his sense of loss after his sister's death, he had chosen notably two of his sisters as his bridesmaid; therefore, when it came time to write about what happened later on, we called the novel's main protagonist Yu Zhan'ao the 'wandering matchmaker.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Though my grandmother was already married with him in the field of sorghum grain, she still had a happy time there in that half-bitter/half-delicious solemn process, though she also carried some guilt for it. chinese: 道路两边，板块般的高粱坚固凝滞，连成一体，拥拥挤挤，彼此打量，灰绿色的高粱穗子睡眼未开，这一穗与那一穗根本无法区别，高粱永无尽头，仿佛潺潺流动的河流。

chinese: 他们杀人越货，精忠报国，他们演出过一幕幕英勇悲壮的舞剧，使我们这些活着的不肖子孙相形见绌，在进步的同时，我真切地感到种的退化。

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): They kill with zeal and fidelity; their ballets embody the words of Shakespeare. They perform a commentary on our declining civilization, and that itself is an indication of their worth. I feel that my own development has been degenerating.

chinese: 半日鸦雀不闻。 忽见两个人抬了一张炕桌来，放在这边炕上，桌上碗盘摆列，仍是满满的鱼肉，不过略动了几样。
english: A long silence ensued in which not so much as a cheep could be heard; then two women came in bearing a small, low table which they set down on the kang. It was covered with bowls and dishes containing all kinds of meat and fish, only one or two of which appeared to have been touched.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Half a day, no one hears of it. Suddenly I saw two people come over from the other side with a table on one side, placed there, all filled with fish and meat, but they moved just a few things here and there.

After a certain number of days the noise of human activity had stopped, but just then something happened that threw up a pair of chairs which they had brought from side to side on the same bed. There,坐着一个锅碗盏炉，满满的一大锅鱼肉还是新鲜的，但移动了几样。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Half a day without any noise. Suddenly, two people brought in a bed table, placed on this side of the bed, bowls and dishes arranged neatly, still filled with fish and meat, but with just a few changes.

But no sound came from the kitchen; then two people came in with a table balanced on their shoulders and filled with dishes of fish and meat, so differently arranged only that the positions of a few items had been slightly exchanged.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Half a day, I didn't hear any birds or insects outside. Suddenly, two people came up with a table on one side of the炕. The table was lined up with bowls and dishes. Still full of fish and meat, but there were some changes made to it.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: After a certain number of days the noise of human activity ceased, but suddenly there was to be heard a murmur of curiosity: people were looking round them from time to time, and when, this time, two gentlemen appeared, they found themselves perched on the kang-tables with their dinner. There, too, the plates were set out with the same dishes as before; but this time the only changes made were merely a few rotations.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Half the day was silent. Suddenly two people came with a bed table, setting it up on this side of the bed, still full of fish and meat, but just moved a few things around.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Half a day, I have not heard of them. Suddenly, two people came out from behind a table, carried it over here on the bed, and there were still plenty of fish and meat on the table. But they did not move any more.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Half a day went by without a sound. Suddenly, two people came carrying a bed table, placing it on this side of the bed, with bowls and dishes arranged neatly, but not much change was made to the fish and meat.

chinese: 薛蟠忙道：“好兄弟，我原为求你快些出来，就忘了忌讳这句话，改日你要哄我，也说我父亲，就完了。”
english: 'Now look here, old chap,' said Xue Pan, getting agitated, 'it was only because I wanted to fetch you out a bit quicker. I admit it was very wrong of me to make free with your Parent, but after all, you've only got to mention my father next time you want to fool me and we'll be quits!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Good friends, I wanted you to hurry up and come out of this place; it was not my intention to change your mind about me and say that you were father."

Oh friend, if you'll will not forget me,' said Bao-yu, 'I came here to ask you first thing today, and now that we have the matter out of our minds; and besides, it would be unfair on your father if I did it, if I promise you.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Xuezhang hurriedly said, "Good brother, I originally wanted to ask you for help quickly, so that I could forget this word, but I forgot it later. If you want to make me happy again, just say my father's name."

chinese: 贾蔷翻身出来，纸笔现成，拿来叫贾瑞写。 他两个做好做歹，只写了五十两银子，画了押，贾蔷收起来。 然后撕掳贾蓉。
english: Jia Qiang at once disappeared and reappeared only a moment later with paper and a writing-brush which had evidently been made ready in advance. Writing at his dictation Jia Rui was compelled, in spite of protests, to put down fifty taels of silver as the amount on the IOU. The document, having been duly signed, was at once pocketed by Jia Qiang, who then pretended to seek the connivance of Jia Rong.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Jiā yé yīn qǐ chū, zǎo bǎ sì chéng, lái kàn jiē qù ào zhě, wò jǐ yǒu ào zhú. Yī kǔ bǎ wài tā yào cǐ xíng chēng. Wà bǎ xià cǐ yǒu ào zhú, zài 502 nán yǔ shì diǎnr, huà xiàng pèng, jiǎng yǐ xiù. Jiǎng yè qǔ qiú. Jiǎng yè fēng. Shì tàn qīng jiǎo.

He jumped up when Jia Qiang's body came滚了过来，并且趁他不动时抓来文房山儿，拿他写的一张“硅石”三个字说:「借二十两钱玩儿！」 那贾瑞便拿笔在纸上画了个「回环」 two words at the end of it, then took the paper together with him, for he had been afraid that Jia Qiang might repeat it again. He then drew a 'loop' on the other side of which he said he would lend the other three words to use as he pleased. Jia Qiang received his papers by turning them over on a sheet of paper and holding them up like this: 'I've borrowed twenty taels of silver to spend a while at Green Delights. I'll spend the rest here.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Jia Rui got up and wrote out paper and ink. He wrote a hundred pieces of silver on it. He signed his name with his father’s name and sealed the document. Jia Rui took it away. Then he tore up Jia Rong.

When Jia Qiang threw himself from the bed, papers were already ready at his feet, so Jia Rui proceeded to make his bargain as follows: Fifty taels of silver and two drawings of a handprint on the promissory note would constitute his payment. He and Jia Rong then tore up the paper to prevent Jia Lin from seeing what had happened.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Jiā yě bǎo xià chéng, zhú píng kēng, jiù gǔ zuǒ qǐ, jīng wài sì shàng. Zǐ tā gè gè zài dào, yǐ zhěn rán yuè liǎng bǎo yǐ qǐ. Qǐ yě chuán còu. Jīng huā yàn fáng. Jīng yǐ nòng. Jīng yě néng yǐ yǔ.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: He rose up abruptly and gave chase to his handkerchief, which fluttered in his hand, and picked up a total of fifty cash. He took this, together with the indentifications, and drew them on. Then he tore out both of Jia Rui's papers.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Jia Rui got up and took out a piece of paper and pen. He handed them to Jia Rong and asked him to write something. They made no progress at all. In the end, they wrote fifty two pieces of silver and drew a bond. Then, he threw away Jia Rong.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: When Jia Qiang threw himself back down, there was still time for Jia Rong to make a bargain: how much should we write? Fifty taels! Wèi jìn cì yǐ yǒu yù yǔ. ěr cháng gǔ rén dào tóng, zhěn bǎi lǐ yǔ qīng diǎnr sì shí rán bǎi liǎng líng yǐ, wéi yǔ yǔ hòu. Wú yǔ yǔ hòu, wéi yǔ yǔ hòu. Zhì yǐ chéng qù yóu chōng qǐ lǎn.

chinese: 八月深秋，无边无际的高粱红成洸洋的血海，高粱高密辉煌，高粱凄婉可人，高粱爱情激荡。
english: In late autumn, during the eighth lunar month, vast stretches of red sorghum shimmered like a sea of blood. Tall and dense, it reeked of glory; cold and graceful, it promised enchantment; passionate and loving, it was tumultuous.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: In August autumn, vast fields of corn turn red like a blood sea, with tall corn standing high and splendid, with tender corn that is also tragic and beautiful, and corn love that is passionate.

In August, autumn was in full swing. Inundated with red sorghum, not just patches but an unceasing expanse of it, stood in stark contrast with the surrounding desolate landscape, a beautiful agonised love story.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In early autumn, a sea of red corn, which is the blood of the harvest, was overflowing with the glory of high corn, its brilliance shining brightly, and its tenderness touching the heart, and its passion burning.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: In thorns-free September, sorghum in the bloodshaped highland was as red as blood, scarlet hues that oozed with passion and beauty.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In August autumn, vast fields of corn are red as blood seas. Corn is dense and splendid. Corn is sad and lovely. Corn loves passionately.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Autumn in August brought fire and blood to the immeasurable fields of sorghum, turning it a radiant red; in contrast, the stalks looked lost and charming.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In August, the red stalks of high-corn were like a sea of crimson, their glory so bright that it was hard to see through. The corn stalks were grand and vibrant, with the aroma of sweetness and passion filling the air. High-ornamented, high-corn was a symbol of love, but also pain.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The sorghum, red as blood, had turned red all along the country, and the sorghum fields were so dense that one could barely get across if he didn't want to. Sorghum graves shone with tears, mournful people wept, loved ones grieved.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: In August, the deep autumn is full of crimson sunflowers, golden fields, and passionate love.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): In August, the deep autumn glow turns every patch of sorghum field to blood; the sorghum is so dense it looks shimmering, and each plant seems to be crying out in lonely love.

chinese: 这些人嘴里尊称自己是香主，满口什么静候香主吩咐云云，其实各人肚里早就有了主意，只盼得到自己赞同，于是一切便推在韦香主头上，日后他们就不会担当重大干系。
english: It was all 'Master this' and 'Master that' and respectfully waiting to be told by the Master what they should do; but invariably they had already decided what they wanted to do and only wanted the Master's approval for doing it, so that if there was any question about it later, the Master would have sole responsibility for what they had done.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The people who claim they are the "Master of香气" are simply making up their own nonsense by saying things like "We have no idea what your will is, but we must obey it". The real reason behind this is that each person already has a plan of action inside their minds. They just hope for someone to agree with them, so they do everything under the nose of the "Master of香气". In the future, they won't be involved in important matters at all.

It is their elders who stand as祭司口头的神甫, who tell us what to do in accordance with his commands. But all along the way the boys have been默守其政, silently determining what they really wish from him—and all the while they have been secretly preparing their own replies should their master decide. By which time it is too late for them to appeal to him; and they simply let it drop, knowing that he shall now be the centre of every discussion.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: These people, who call themselves "masters" and say such things as "waiting for a master's orders", really have their own minds already. They just want to get their approval so that they can avoid any major responsibilities. Therefore, once these people are blamed, they will not be held responsible at all.

These eunuchs talk with their mouths about how they await their master's instructions; but deep down they all have their own ideas and are merely waiting for Trinket to give them an order. Once he is satisfied, all responsibility for the actions that will follow falls on Trinket. From then on it is up to him how far they go.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The people speak of themselves as a "Chen Master" and make all sorts of promises that they will be given instructions from the Chen Master one day, but their hearts have no idea what they should do. They just hope for approval, which is why everything falls on them. The Chen Master will not be responsible for anything significant.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: It is the same with the people speaking of their Master. All they say when anyone else asks them what their instructions are are 'May I have your services?'—'I expect you will give me such and such a order.' But all they imply inwardly is, 'I wish I were your Comrade-remain unimproviated.' They have already long formed their own opinions about who their task was and what lay ahead of them. They merely hope that their master will agree with them—and this greatly depends on their agreeing． . . . In the end it is the individual who endorses Whiskers who carries on the business of transporting the Prince to his quarters—that is, to speak frankly—a task which involves no great importance, and who therefore takes no credit for himself at all.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: These people spoke of themselves as the Master of Incense when they were speaking with their mouths full, saying things like "waiting for a master's orders." In fact, each had already made up his mind. He just wanted to get it approved by the Master of Incense so that he would not be held responsible for any major issues later on.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: These eunuchs always refer to themselves as 'Aroma Main Man' and, whenever they talk about waiting for their master's instructions, are thinking up all sorts of things to do while he is away. All they want is for him to agree to be their mistress, and then all manner of mischief they could get up would be shifted on to someone else's conscience -- yours, Master, in this case.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The people who speak of themselves as the Master of the香气， talk about what they should be waiting for from the香气 Master's orders; in fact, each person has already got a plan in his or her mind, just hoping that he or she will get approval from the香气 Master, so that one day they won’t have any major responsibility.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): These men would all be given the jibber-jabber of 'Master of the Society' before getting down to business, but in reality each of them already had a consensus about their task, and it was merely a question of getting away comfortably along to its completion. Once thatconsensuswas reached, the responsibility for it fell entirely on Trinket.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: These people speak highly of themselves as "Scent Masters" but say all sorts of things like waiting for a Scent Master's instructions, when in fact each has his own idea already. They simply want to be told that their ideas have been approved by the Scent Master, so they will not have to take responsibility for any serious matters later on.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Theseimpsaddress themselves to their 'master' with the respectful courtesies of the Chahang tradition, muttering interjections like, 'Wait for your master's instructions,' as if all waiting for them was a dispensation from their master to go about carrying on with business. So having done their bidding, they can scarcely be blamed for passing the blame onto Trinket, and then, when he objects, putting all the blame on his shoulders.

chinese: 雨打倒了无数的高粱，雨在田野里狂欢，蛤蟆躲在高粱根下，哈达哈达地抖着颌下雪白的皮肤； 狐狸蹲在幽暗的洞里，看着从高粱上飞溅而下的细小水珠，道路很快就泥泞不堪，杂草伏地，矢车菊清醒地擎着湿漉漉的头。
english: Sorghum crumpled under the wild rain. Toads took refuge under the stalks, their white pouches popping in and out noisily; foxes hid in their darkened dens to watch tiny drops of water splashing down from the sorghum plants.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The rain destroyed countless high粱， it played a drunken game of life on the fields. The harpy was hiding under the stalks of the tall beans， his face snow-white as he let out the small drops of water that were shot up by the clouds. The dew covered its path， making mud slippery and tangled. The fox sat inside the dimly-lit hole， looking at the falling drops from the beans as they fell like tiny specks of snow. The tulip bush had been standing upright when it woke up and was now dripping wet with a wetting head.

Every stalk of sorghum was struck by a storm of rain, and to hide from the reveling water, Toads hiding under the roots scolded white sandy plains. foxes huddled in dark burrows, watching with interest the small drops streaking down from the stalks, the path soon becomes caked in mud, thistle clings to the dried-out head. The cornflowers stand up, their heads drenched by wet whisks.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The rain beat down on countless corn stalks, raining down in the fields, frogs hiding in the roots of the corn, shaking their white skin with a dance; foxes huddled in the dark cave, watching the tiny drops that fell from the corn stalks, soon making the road muddy, weeds lying flat, daisies awake holding wet heads.

The rain beats against countless sorghum stalks, causing them to sway back and forth in the field; the frogs hide under the sorghum roots, wriggling their white, snowy skin until it shines like a rainbow. The fox crouches in a dark cave, watching the tiny drops of water fly midair. In no time at all the path becomes muddied, the grass bent over, and the bitz flower stands up calmly amid the wet foliage.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The rain has destroyed countless high-corn fields, it is dancing on the fields. The bumblebees hiding under the stalks of the stalked corn are shaking their white skin as they dance around in the field; the fox sits at a dimly lit hole in the ground, watching the tiny drops of water that fall from the corn stalks, and soon the roads become muddy again, with weeds growing up beneath them, the tulip seedlings sprout from the wet soil.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Millions of sorghum bodies fell to the ground, each one shaking itself with each gust of wind. chinese: 那刘老老先听见告艰苦，只当是没想头了， 又听见给他二十两银子，喜的眉开眼笑道：“我们也知道艰难的，但只俗语说的：‘瘦死的骆驼比马还大’呢。
english: When Grannie Liu heard Xi-feng talk about 'difficulties' she concluded that there was no hope. Her delight and the way in which her face lit up with pleasure when she heard that she was, after all, to be given twenty taels of silver can be imagined. 'We knew you had your troubles,' she said, 'but as the saying goes, 'A starved camel is bigger than a fat horse.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: That's what Liu old man told him first. He thought he was thinking of his own thoughts; then he heard that he got twenty pieces of silver for him, and laughed happily: "We know how hard it is, but just from what I've learned from my mother tongue 'soreness' is also a sign of suffering."

At the time their little presence was unknown to him, but as he listened more and more they became increasingly anxious: it was as if every word he said were weighing on his soul. 'I know how hard it is,' he thought. 'But according to the saying 'fat birds are greater than horses' . .'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Tao Lao was first struck by the hardships, thinking that he had lost his mind, hearing him give him twenty gold pieces, he burst out laughing and said, "We also know difficulties, but the saying goes, 'a skinny camel is as big as a horse'."
At first Mo爹听到这女孩说起难处时还把她当作没有听出话来，直到Twenty唐拿出二十两银子给他说的时候，他才又惊又喜地睁开眼睛笑眯眯地说起来：「听人常说‘肥猪八两卖不穷’，如今我们二两银子也有人给，也算得是‘瘦死的骆驼比马大’吧！」
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The Teng Old Grandfather heard that his old age was hard for him, and thought it was a waste of time. Then he heard that he received twenty two baos, which made him smile happily. "We know how difficult things are, but we have heard that the saying is: 'a horse that is thin cannot be as big as a man.'"

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): According to old Grannie Liu, it was a signal sign that she had been chosen by chance to suffer with them; for before her very eyes there was already enough food for two people for the whole year, and yet it turned out that one of the terms of the task was to give twenty taels of silver over to its occupant. This made her look forward with pleasant lips: 'We know how hard it is going down a slope—and I suppose everyone knows that ‘a thin rock holding a camel together will not hold a man'!

chinese: 她有一次夜半被叫醒。 人们早已入睡，那叫声便显得格外惊动，带着些危急和恐怖。 王琦瑶的心擂鼓似的怦怦响着，她睡衣外面披上件夹袄便下楼去开门，见是两个乡下人，抬了一个担架，躺着垂危的病人，说是请王医师救命。
english: Once, awakened in the middle of the night by urgent and frightened calls for help at the door, she threw a jacket over her nightgown and rushed downstairs, her heart pounding, to find two men from the provinces carrying someone on a stretcher. The person was critically ill.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Once upon a time, she was woken up at midnight by someone calling out, with some of her heart pounding as it did so. The sound was especially alarming and ominous. Wang Qiara's heart pounded in her chest, and she slipped on the clothes that had been thrown over her shoulders, leaving her to go downstairs and open the door, seeing two farmers, one carrying a stretcher, lying on lifeless patients. They were asking for her help to save their lives.

One time she was woken by someone late in the night. The people there were already asleep by the time she had registered for the wake-up call. The noise was scary and alarming, and Wang Qiyao felt a pounding heart that sent her to the floor. She just下了楼，发现两个本地人躺在病人身边，说王文波大夫正在救他命。

One night, suddenly disturbed by a call, she woke up halfway through sleep. The sound of someone else's breathing awakened her and frightened her. She could feel her heart racing as she got out of bed and put on a sweater. chinese: 轿夫们停住，呆呆地看着劈腿横在路当中的劫路人。 那人身材不高，脸上涂着黑墨，头戴一顶高粱篾片编成的斗笠，身披一件大蓑衣，蓑衣敞着，露出密扣黑衣和拦腰扎着的宽腰带。 腰里别着一件用红绸布包起的鼓鼓囊囊的东西。
english: The bearers stopped in their tracks and stared dumbstruck at the highwayman of medium height who stood in the road, his legs akimbo. He had smeared his face black and was wearing a conical rain hat woven of sorghum stalks and a broad-shouldered rain cape open in front to reveal a black buttoned jacket and a wide leather belt, in which a protruding object was tucked, bundled in red satin.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The men stopped on the street and stared at a man who was lying on the ground with his legs hanging over the road. His body was low and he wore a black mask, which was made of bamboo cloth that had been sewn together in a way that looked like a cap. The hat was high up on his head and it covered most of his face. He was wearing a large coat that was spread out over him, and the sleeves were open and there were strings tied around them. Inside the bag was something red that had been wrapped in a piece of paper.

The bearers stopped and stared, then, as he lay ahead across the road killing a highwayman: It was tall, with a thick headboard of dark-soiled straw; his body was covered by a long piece of sorghum cloth sewn at the waist; his belt was exposed, containing a tightly looped black garment that held him up. At the hem of his jacket were strings of red handkerchiefs.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The oxen stopped and gazed at the man who was squatting on the road, his legs crossed. He was a short man with black make-up smeared across his face. He wore a high reed hat made of straw and a long, wide belt around his waist. In his waistband was something wrapped in red silk.

The bearers halted, staring at the footpedaling highwayman; he was no more than five feet four inches tall, but his face was unusually handsome, covered with dark ink. He wore a willow top hat, a palm-bark rain cape, and a baggie of stuff around his waist, the front of which revealed a bright red band of cloth holding in place a bulging belly.

chinese: 它原先是一片蛮荒地，荆榛苇茅丛生，狐狸野兔的乐园，后来有了几架牧人的草棚，后来逃来了杀人命犯、落魄酒徒、亡命赌棍…… 他们建造房屋，开垦荒地，拓扑出人的乐园，狐狸野兔迁徙他乡，临别时齐声发出控诉人类的鸣叫。
english: At one time the site had been a wasteland covered with brambles, underbrush, and reeds, a paradise for foxes and wild rabbits. Then a few huts appeared, and it became a haven for escaped murderers, drunks, gamblers, who built homes, cultivated the land, and turned it into a paradise for humans, forcing out the foxes and wild rabbits, who set up howls of protest on the eve of their departure.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The land was once a place of wilderness, where thorns and moss covered the ground, where foxes and rabbits roamed, and there were some wooden huts for the shepherd's wives to live in. But over time, they built a few houses, then came up with a few more, and then a few more, until they had all left their mark on people's lives. The foxes and rabbits migrated from one place to another, each calling out a cry of human distress.

Before then the place was nothing but ditches, willows, and foxes, herons, and weasels. Some monks had built cottages. Then traffic had come from farmers' huts, and lastly ruthless gamblers and thieves had run away, promising a place of death for anyone who crossed their path. The deer and foxes had fled to other parts, calling out curse words as they flew toward the destructed houses and turned back to see their human hosts.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: It was once a wild land of thorns, willows, and reeds, home to foxes and rabbits. But after that came several tents for farmers, then some fugitives from crime, outcasts from drinking, and gamblers who had run away from their lives… They built houses and cultivated the land, creating human gardens where foxes and rabbits migrated, and as they left, they all cried out against humanity.

A desolate wilderness once covered with bushes, sorghum, and reeds, it was home to foxes and rabbits until a few scattered huts were built by farmers and cultivated by settlers. Gloomy messages were emitted when the human inhabitants fled the land of their dreams.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: It was once a barren place, where thorns and grass grew, and the denizens of the woods lived happily. Then came a few houses of farmers, who built meadows and cleared land. They then built homes for themselves, while the foxes and rabbits migrated to other parts of the world, and their voices could be heard as they made their last journey together.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Before, it was a deserted place, cluttered with wild vegetation long enough for foxes and herons to live, or poor drunkards to flee; later they came sheep and snakes settling in their sheds, wandering across the land as they built houses, screeching at humans as they planted crops, tortoises and crabs moving abroad as they called out their agony.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: It was once a wild place, filled with thorns, reeds, and foxes and rabbits, until the arrival of a few herders' huts, then came out killers, vagabonds, and gamblers… They built houses, cleared land, and made human paradise. The foxes and rabbits moved away, leaving behind their cries of complaint at man's destruction.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: A desolate area, home to wild foxes and rabbits, it had once hosted a few scattered adobe houses built by ranchers who, having fallen on hard times, had then drawn upon it as a den for delinquent gamblers and desperate murderers.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: It was once a desolate place where thorns and grass grew wild, where foxes and rabbits played their favorite spots, and later came the presence of farmers’ huts. Later, they escaped from killers, outlaws, and gamblers. They built houses, cultivated farmland, shaped spaces for humans, and accused the animals of crying in human’s ears.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Before then the place was nothing but dense treetops, wild foxes, heron after heron, as long as they could find their homes; later on a few monks' huts came along with them—a few of them had committed heinous crimes—thieves, alcohol abusers, renegade husbands—to whom they made their final salutations: a chorus of "human calls!" For them.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: It was once a wilderness where foxes and rabbits played, but now it has been turned into a man-made paradise by some human settlers who built houses and cultivated land. The animals have moved away and are no longer heard calling out their lament for humanity.

Later, around the time a few farmers settled down there, a set of mud huttinghas appeared. Then, murderers and common folk seeking solace in alcohol arrived, and from the的压力杀人狂和赌瘾大盛的混蛋们逃来,成了理想家园。狐狸和野兔则被迫迁往他乡,在离开之前悲泣人类这段不识相的经历。

I took the time to attend her mother's funeral,' I told you, 'and brought a bit or two back with me. Now they've got a supply themselves. I'd hoped to keep them all for themselves, but now that my temps have run out I can't afford it. It'll be some from one or two other gentlemen who serve at your太太's wedding if we haven't any left.

What remained I kept for myself; but since eating it would involve me in sin, I engaged my thoughts on how to distribute it so as not to offend Heaven. Finally I decided that since it was for my own benefit only that I chose not to take any of it, I should give it to old Lady Wang's husband.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Firstly I took care of my mother, and then we delivered some to you. Now, I have left a lot; I am afraid that it will be a curse to me if I don’t eat them myself. Left to my own devices, I would certainly not eat them.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I gave her a little for her birthday and am sending some to Her Ladyship's as well. I've got a good deal left for myself now; but right now I can't see what's the point in keeping them, so I'm thinking: What's the same kind of trouble would I pose for You if I ate them all?
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I first took care of my mother, then sent some for your grandmother and aunt. Now I have kept a few, for I do not want to deprive myself of eating them. I think that no one else is fit for eating them except you.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I first had to show my mother some consideration; then, as a matter of generosity, I gave a little to your ladyship and your amah. Nowadays I have left enough to myself; but I have to think whether I shan't be able to claim my share. In doing this I have finally come to the conclusion that except you there is nobody else who is entitled to it.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: First I showed respect for my mother, and then we sent some of this to you. Right now we have a little left, so I am afraid it will be a curse to me. After thinking about it, I wonder whether there is anyone who would still be able to eat after I leave this world.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I gave our mother a place of residence first. As I was on my way to see Her Old Ladyship and her sister-in-law, to make sure you had everything you needed, I sent them off with some of the flour I had left over from my own diet. Now they've got plenty themselves, and I can't come near them for fear of disappointment. So it's decided I will now take the risk of eating you myself.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: I first showed respect for my mother, then sent some food to your grandmother and aunt. I now have a little left over, so that I can eat it myself, which would be detrimental to my reputation. I am thinking of you first because no one else is worthy enough to eat this.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I offered some of it as a gift to your mother; this you ought to understand was done with utmost modesty. I thought it right first to satisfy her wishes; but having now satisfied her, I thought it was due to you to give you some also. What I left over I wanted for myself—but on the other hand I think if I吃了对不住算我多吃，叫你空欢喜；所以最后我还是拿去给你了。

chinese: 村里街道上也水深及膝，骡马牛羊都泡在水里，水上漂着牲畜们稀薄的排泄物。
english: The water in the village was knee-high, covering the legs of livestock, whose waste floated on the surface.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Water was deep enough for a knee-high horse and mule and all the animals were soaking up the sewage from the water.
The streets were filled with water – at least six feet. Shefeng, mules, donkeys, and flocks of goats threw their stink as far away as possible.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The streets of the village were flooded up to their knees with water as well. Cattle, horses, and sheep were floating in it, while the feces from their urine was floating on top of the water.
On the streets of the village, the water was as deep as people's ankles, and mules, horses, and buffalo swam around in it until it was covered with their excrement.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Near the village's streets too, water was up to their knees, and horses, sheep, and cattle were swimming in it, leaving traces of their excrement on the surface.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The streets were filled with water – enough for a pair of shoes or a buffalo huss – and animals (horse, cattle, goats), human waste from their meals, bobbed and贝在水上漂着。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The streets of the village were also flooded up to the knee, horses, mules, and sheep all floating in the water, while their feces floated on top of it.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Village streets were waist-deep with water, even for the oxen and mules, who swam around floating chunks of their excrement.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: In the village streets as well, water was at least knee-deep; horses, mules, and cows were soaking wet; the water carried out of them the faintly defecating droppings of the livestock.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As the village roads were all about six feet deep, rats,蛇类,狐狸以及一些肥猪、肥牛都在路上行走,路上积水上涨,阻碍通行,老鼠和蛇类尸体垃圾亦可飘至道路两侧。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The streets of the village were waist-deep in water too, with horses, mules, and sheep all floating in it, with their excrement floating on top.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): On the village streets the water was chest deep, and horses, mules, and buffalo were swimming in it; above the animals' feces floated their wet bodies.

chinese: 我在一边看完了才走。
english: I didn't leave until I witnessed the whole episode.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: I have watched a movie on one side before I left.
I finished reading my story before I left and walked away from here.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: I finished watching before I left.
I finished reading it when I saw it.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I finished reading before I left.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: As I finished reading, I left the office.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: I finished watching before I left.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I finished reading it when I saw it.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: I finished reading one book before I left.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I finished reading, and then left here soon after.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: I left after finishing watching it on one side.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I finished reading it while you were away.

chinese: 低头看去，宽阔笔直的马路上跑着如豆的汽车，成串的亮珠子。
english: Below, the cars speeding down the straight broad roads looked like a chain of pearls.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Looking down at them, there were like a dozen cars running on that straight road, each with a bright pearl shining from it.
As he looked down, a broad road was crossed by endless buses, connected by litters of watches.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Look down; the wide straight road is filled with small cars moving in rows of light beads.
But as he looked更低，他看见宽阔平坦的道路上飞舞着千百颗汽车灯，一列长的汽车像无数明亮的串联珍珠在行驶。
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Looking down at it, there was a line of cars running on straightaway across the broad road, with bright lights flashing like beads.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: As he looked down, a broad, plathographic road was being overtaken by vast, unbroken lines of red-and-white buses.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Looking down, a broad straight road is filled with cars like tiny beads running in rows.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Lowering his head, he could see wide, straight roads filled with cars travelling at a steady pace like faraway sparks on a broad road.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: As one walks by a wide road of cars running like beans, there are numerous small beads of light.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): As he looked down, a broad road was crossed by straight, narrow buses lined up like pebbles; one could see a line of few dozen red stars floating in the air.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Looking down, there were cars zooming along the wide straight road like small lamps, with a string of bright light bulbs.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But as she looked down, she saw a dense curtain of cars moving along the highway, like beads on a string, passing back and forth.

chinese: 成名如此之早，当真古今罕有。”
english: To have won such fame, and so early in life too, is an almost unparalleled achievement.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: It was so early for him that he had never seen anything like it before."
And he did, apparently, during his lifetime, '
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Such a great success at such a young age is truly unprecedented in history."
To be named after so young an age is indeed rare indeed.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: It is so early that one does not know of it from ancient times."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: And he did, you know, when you first became famous . . .'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He was so famous at such a young age, truly rare indeed.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: To be a success like this early in life—isn't that rare history?'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The translation of this phrase from Chinese to English is: "It's a great honor for him to be born so early."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): And he did seem unusual for a young man to成名这么早！」
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: He has already achieved fame so early in his life, truly rare in history.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): To be a famous writer by such an early age must indeed be rare history.'

chinese: 待雄飞高举，明冬再晤，岂非大快之事！”
english: How delightful it will be to meet again next winter when you have distinguished yourself by soaring to the top over all the other candidates!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wait for his flight to take him up high, then we will meet again next winter. Is this not a great thing!"
The sight of him soaring high above the frost-free air and meeting up with her again in the clear winter days to pursue their shared desire... that sounds like a very satisfying affair.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wait for the king to fly high and meet again in the winter!"
When you are ready to carry your flight, I shall expect to see you again soon in the winter.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wait for him to fly high and meet again in spring next year. How come it is a great thing!"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Had we got lucky and won that contest, what would have been the plaisir of catching a freebird in winter!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Let him soar high in the winter, we will meet again in the coming year!"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: When you are finally freed, come back here again冬天里。 Then we can meet once more, and I promise you a快乐的事!'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Wait for him to fly high and meet again next winter, isn't that a great pleasure!"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Then, when the flying stork has soared to its highest point and then flown again, one shall have an excellent opportunity for gratification!'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Let him fly high now, then we will meet again in the winter! Isn't that a great thing!"
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Perhaps next winter when the phoenix has flown so high again I can meet you once more in the courtyard.'

chinese: 纵声大笑，身子跟着乱动，右腿一曲，右手已抓住了匕首柄，极慢极慢的从剑鞘中拔出，不发出丝毫声息，就算有了些微声，也教笑声给遮掩住了。
english: He kept up the artificial laughter in order to cover up the wriggling of his body. While he was talking and laughing he had managed to draw up his right leg so that he could get his hand on the dagger in his boot and draw it from its sheath. Any slight sound that this operation might have given rise to was masked by his idiotic cachinnation.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Quietly laughing, his body moved as if he was following a song. He raised his right leg and grasped the handle of the knife, slowly and carefully from the sheath of the sword. There was no sound when he pulled out the blade, not even a single sound. Even if there was a slight noise, it would be drowned out by the laughter.

He let out a great loud cry, and gave way to wild movements which made his right leg turn aside; then he drew his dagger from his sheath and picked it suddenly out of it. He allowed none of the noises that should be made, although they seemed almost imperceptible, to掩盖他的欢声笑闹。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Laughing loudly, he moved about wildly with his body, bending his right leg and grasping the handle of the dagger with his left hand. He slowly extracted it from its scabbard, making no sound at all, even if a whisper could be heard. Even a faint sound would be covered up by the laughter.

He began laughing loudly; his body started rolling from side to side, as he withdrew the dagger and held it tight between palm and hand. It was a very gradual and meandering motion, so that even if the sound of his breathing had been heard, it would have been more than outweighed by the noise of his big grinning smile.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The voice of laughter rang out from his mouth, followed by a series of uncontrollable movements. His right leg turned, his hand grasped the handle of the sword. Slowly, slowly, he pulled out the dagger with a slow, deliberate motion. There was no sound as if there were any. Even though there was some noise, it was drowned out by the laughter.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: He let out a loud laughing fit, but his right leg gave way before he was done throwing the dagger from his hip and drawing it from his sheath. He could hear only laughter as he did, but whatever it was he was doing seemed to be completely masked by the creaking of that laugh.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Laughing loudly, he moved about wildly with his body. With his right leg bent, he reached out his right hand and grabbed the hilt of the dagger. He slowly pulled it out from its sheath without making a sound at all. Even if there was some faint noise, it would be covered by the laughter.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: He began laughing loudly, his body starting in a series of jerks and twitches; then, very slowly, he placed the point of the dagger in his grip, and though making no sound, drew it free of the sheath.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Silent laughter echoed through the room, and the body moved with great force as he leered at the wall. He was already grabbing the blade's handle from his bag and pulling it out slowly. The sound of his laughter was not heard except for a small amount of noise; he wanted to hide the sound away."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He let out a great cry of delight while his body went freefalling left right. He kicked his legs out, pulled the dagger from his hand, took out his pocket knife, and waited for the noise to make its noise. It would make some noise, but a laugh would cover it.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Laughing loudly, his body moving around wildly, he bent his right leg as he drew his hand up from the scabbard, drawing out the dagger very slowly with no sound at all, even though there was a slight noise, it would be covered by the laughter.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He threw a great laugh which set the old man's teeth ache; then, as the butcher was howling with laughter, he reached forward and grasped the dagger handle with his right hand. Slowly he drew it out of its sheath, until almost noiselessly removed it from the belt.

chinese: 他似乎没听见。 我劈手把牛鼻绳夺了下来，他就朝我挥了一巴掌。
english: He didn't seem to hear me, so I snatched the tether from him and he slapped me without thinking.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: He did not hear me. I took the bull's nose chain from him, and he gave a slap at me.
He didn't hear me, though. I ripped the stork harness from him and he gave me a slap.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: He didn't seem to hear me. I snatched the ox's snare out of his hands, and he slapped me across the face with a palm.
He didn't seem to hear me; I snatched the leach-patron rope from him and he swiped at me with a palm.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He did not hear it. I took out the bull's nose rope from him and he gave me a slap.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: He didn't hear me. So I ripped the bull-horn harness from him and he gave me a slap.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: He didn’t seem to hear me. I snatched away the ox’s bridle and he slapped me across the face with his hand.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: He didn't seem to hear me; I reached across him and took the rope in my hands. He flashed me a slap.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: He did not hear it. I cut off his nose chain and he hit me on the head with a fist.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He didn't hear me, though. I torn his harness away and gave him a slap.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: He didn't seem to hear me. I snatched off his bullwhip with a swift movement of my hand, and he slapped me across the face.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): He didn't seem to hear me. I reached for the rope holding the cow's nose to her head and took it away. Then he slapped me with the rope.

chinese: 世界是平的，向各个方向延伸到很远很远，但总是有边的。
english: The world was flat and extended very far in each direction, but ultimately there was an edge where it met the sky.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The world is flat, stretching out from every direction, but always there is a border.
The world is flat, always there somewhere.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The world is flat, extending far and wide but always with edges.
The world is flat, extending far and wide in all directions; but it never seems to end.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The world is flat, extending infinitely in all directions, but always has a border.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The world is flat, always there somewhere.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The world is flat; it extends in all directions very far, but there always is a border.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The world is flat, which extends far and wide; but it never reaches infinity.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The world is flat, stretching out infinitely from every direction, but always has a border.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The world is flat, always having a boundary.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The world is flat – extending far and wide in all directions – but always has edges.

chinese: 奶奶站在路边，听着七零八落的打击肉体的沉闷声响，对着余占鳌顿眸一瞥，然后仰面看着天边的闪电，脸上凝固着的，仍然是那种粲然的、黄金一般高贵辉煌的笑容。
english: Grandma stood beside the road listening to the dull cacophony of fists and feet on flesh; she glanced at Yu Zhan'ao, then looked up at the lightning-streaked sky, the radiant, golden, noble smile still frozen on her face.

chinese: 他的意识中一片空白，只有倒计时在那暗红的背景辐射上显现着，跳动着，他自己仿佛变成了一个单纯的计时器，一口不知道为谁而呜的丧钟。
english: His mind was empty of thoughts: Only the countdown pulsed against the dim red background of cosmic radiation. He seemed to have turned into nothing but a simple timer, a bell that tolled for he knew not whom.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: In his mind is a blank space; there's just a pulsating red light shining on that dark background, pulsing like a time bomb. He is himself turned into a simple clock, one which doesn't know who it was for.

All his thoughts were focused on the countdown timer, which was still ticking away at the ancient red clocks embedded in the dark blue background. It sang itself into being a silent chimera that counted for no one except it itself.

chinese: 像她们这样半路上的朋友，各有各的隐衷，别看严家师母竹筒倒豆子，内中也有自己未必知道的保留，彼此并不知根知底，能有一些同情便可以了。
english: People like them, who become friends at mid-life, tend to keep part of themselves hidden away. Even Madame Yan, who usually wore her heart on her sleeve, retained certain secrets that she herself might not have understood. It was not necessary for them to know everything there was to know about each other—a little sympathy went a long way.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: As friends on the way, each with his own hidden motives, it seems that there are different ones for each of them, not that I don’t know anything about the secret or their background, but you can have some sympathy if you want.

People like Wang Qiyao and her friends who came and visited could hardly be described as easy to know. Madam and Mrs. Liu had hidden secrets that they hardly ever mentioned, and no one knew what behind them; yet they did not know each other's hearts and souls and could not build up a solid foundation before offering a怜惜的眼光。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: As half-way friends, they each have their own secrets, like Lady Yin who poured out her chest as if pouring out a jar of beans – there might be some things she did not know herself, but we do not need to know everything about them; just that little bit of sympathy would suffice.

A friend who does not know you all the way has different constraints than she does with regular friends. Even if Madame Yan is willing to go on delivering seeds, there are things she may not want to reveal. It's a matter of trust. They are glad for her simple kindness, but try to act as if they are on equal terms.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Halfway through their friendship, they have different hidden inclinations. While I admire your strict mother, there’s also something she may not know that you don’t either. We can share some empathy and understand each other better.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Wang Qiyao's friends were all different enough to keep her going; even those who drove by didn't know what she was going through and had no way of knowing the depth of her hidden feelings. A little kindness would go a long way to keeping her going.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Those who are friends halfway on their way, each with their own secrets, like Madame Cang of Guan. She does not know what is hidden inside her own chest, but she can understand that others do not know it either. If they can show some understanding, then they will be happy enough.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: If they were to claim each other as friends, they would have to make some sacrifices. It was true that Madame Yan spilt beans like a dripping bamboo barrel, but there must be things she did not know about her friend that she did not share; none of them placed themselves entirely in their friend's shoes, and all they wanted in return for their devotion was a bit of understanding and sympathy.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Like friends who meet halfway on the way, each with their own hidden inclinations, I don’t mean to say that Uncle Li is a fool for putting up such a joke; there may be something we didn’t know that he doesn’t know either. And I can understand them if they can share some compassion with us.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): People like Wang Qiyao and her friends who came and visited could hardly be described as unaccommodable; each of them had hidden secrets that they chose not to discuss with others, and which might have some unexpected relevance to the conversation. To show some sympathy, but not to take advantage of their being interested in old tales, one should try to guess as much as possible from what was being told.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: As friends who meet halfway, each has their own secrets, don’t look at how Madame Dong junks her bamboo tubes like beans, there may be some secrets that she does not know herself either, so we do not need to know each other’s inside and out, just a little understanding can be enough.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Because they had made no journey together, each woman was at liberty to keep her secrets; but who would have thought that Madame Yan, with her full mouth, had any reservations about? It transpired that she had kept them back for herself; but as long as she felt your sympathy, that was all right with her.

chinese: 韦小宝想问他什么叫神堂穴、环跳穴，如何点穴、解穴，但转念一想，自己是青木堂香主，又是总舵主的弟子，连点穴、解穴也不会，岂不是让下属们太也瞧不起？ 反正对付一个小姑娘总不是什么难事，点头道：“知道了。”
english: Trinket wanted to ask him where the Holy Hall and Ring Jump vital points were and how you closed and opened them; but then he remembered that, as Master of the Green Wood Lodge and a disciple of the great Helmsman, he was probably expected to know about these things and felt sure his subordinates would despise him if they found out that he was totally ignorant of these matters; so he just nodded and said that he would. 'Anyway, ' he thought, 'I shouldn't have any difficulty in handling her. She's only a girl.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Qian Xiaobang wanted him to know what a Heaven Pavilion穴和环跳穴是什么意思，怎样用功法来点穴和解穴，但转过头来看，自己是青木堂香主，又是总舵主的弟子，连点穴、解穴都不会，难道会让下属们看轻他？反正对付一个小姑娘的事情也不是很难，点头应道：“知道了。”

I don't know about that secret word you're talking about, Brother,' Trinket was about to asking them what it meant, 'but I do know that it's where a man puts his thumb against whose aim to cause pain and then removes it again as soon as he wants it to stop. It's also the same thing you did when we put our fingers on your target—to give or remove pain as quickly as we want.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wu Xiaoliao wanted to ask him what was a "temple" point and an "arrowhead point", how to do acupuncture and acupressure, but he thought better of it. He was the head disciple of the main hall and the chief of the grotto, so he couldn't even do acupuncture and acupressure. Isn't that embarrassing? Anyway, dealing with a young girl isn't difficult at all. Wu Xiaoliao nodded his head and said, "I understand."

He was thinking of asking the questions that involved names of acupoints and how to stimulate them and how to find the same acupoints after one had been stimulated, but he decided it would be enough for him to be a Taoist副主子和舵主的弟子, even though he didn't know what acupoints were, to be looked down on by his subordinates, when he could do nothing of the sort. He settled for a simple 'yes' instead.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Zhu Zai Ba wants to know what a heaven's temple穴和环跳穴是什么，怎样点穴解穴，但是转念一想，自己是青木堂香主，又是总舵主的弟子，连点穴解穴都不会，难道会让下属们看不起吗？反正对付一个小姑娘也不是什么困难的事情，点头应答："知道啦。"
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I've no idea what those terms are; I don't know how to use it except to pick a number. I haven't ever done anything like this before myself. So it must be really hard for someone like Brother Wei to find out what a神堂穴是什么意思, or how to do it, or—what matters most—and even getting him to解开我的穴具也不容易。 It's hardly a problem I can solve myself.'
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wu Xiaogang wanted to ask him what he meant by "sacred hall points" and "ring point". How did he use them? But then he thought of his position as the head monk of the Yellow Wood Hall and his master's disciple, and even if he couldn't use them himself, he didn't want his subordinates to think that he was too incompetent. In the end, it would be fine for a little girl. He nodded and said, "I understand."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Trinket was about to ask what the Godit was for and where they got their name 'Ringit' from and whether they were supposed to be able to needle and unneedle them—and all the other things that go with it—but he realised that asking these questions would involve giving the girl one of his greater superiors whom he did not know very well a handout, so he changed his mind and took the girl at her word. 'All right, I've heard,' he said.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Zhu Xiaobang wanted to know what a heaven temple point is, how to point it out, and what to do with it, but when he thought about it, he was a member of the Qingming Temple's headmaster, and his chief secretary was also a student who had been under his tutelage. He could not even point or solve for it, would that really make them all look down on him?" No problem! I will now tell you.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I get what 'godfather' is supposed to be for a king; but what're these called in the Mermaids Lodge when you perform them?' he wondered to himself as his pride was about tumbledown. 'If I'd been sent off to treat her with godfatheric, she wouldn't have been any less useless than anyone else. All I've ever done is performed our Hard Headed Brother Li's magic tricks. I'm no match for a little girl.'

chinese: 唉，睡觉的时候以后可多着呢，朝也睡，晚也睡，睡着了永远不醒。
english: There's plenty of sleeping to come: sleeping all day, sleeping all night, sleeping and never waking up again.
