chinese: 平安里的夜晚其实也是有许多想头的，只不过没有王琦瑶窗帘上的大花朵，映显不出来罢了。 许多想头都是沉在心底，沉渣一般。 全是叫生计熬炼的，挤干汁，沥干水，凝结成块，怎么样的激荡也泛不起来。
english: There was a great deal of thinking going on around Peace Lane, but much of it, like sediment, had sunk to the bottom of people's hearts, all the juice squeezed out of them, so that they had solidified and could no longer be stirred up.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The night in the Peace Village was full of thoughts, but no one could see the large flower on Ouyang Guo's curtains. It just appeared as a shadow. Many thoughts were buried deep inside, like a layer of sand. They all were laboring for survival, extracting oil, cleaning water, crystallizing it into small pieces, how could they ever rise up?

Realizing how difficult it is to find words to express what he was feeling, Wang Qiyao hung up her curtains, making the large flowers on the window frame look like moss; but many of her insecurities were saved from内在的沉渣般一直淤积在心底,成不了形不成大小。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The nights of Peaceful Life were also full of thoughts, but they could not be revealed because there was no big flowers on Wang Qiuyue's curtains. Many thoughts were sunk deep in her heart, just like old dirt. They were all made by life to endure, squeezed out their juice, dried up their water, solidified into blocks, and how they would shake up was not possible.

But even at night peace has many headcases, and among these cases is the repressed desire that one never gets to see in full bloom over the windows, where it would make for a lovely curtain. These repressed desires sink to the bottom of people's hearts, where they are washed away by the currents of ordinary living. Filled with passion as they are with the necessity of making ends meet, those heartcases have evaporated into a stiff, congealed substance, incapable of bubbling to the surface.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The night of平安里并不是只有王琦瑶窗前的花朵才感到迷茫，只是缺少王琦瑶窗前的大花朵，反而无法显现出来。许多想法都藏在心中，如同沉淀的污垢。全是一起熬过生活的苦痛，将汗水洗净，把水分结晶，化成一块块，怎么也难以激起波澜。
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Realized? Not all of them were. Wang Qiyao's curtains provided a decent backdrop for the flowers, but many of these thoughts were stuck in her heart—a stew of inertia. The simmering arguments she made were condensed into bits that could have been put on hold until needed.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: In the night of peace, there were many thoughts too, but they couldn't be seen because the curtains on Wang Qiuyue's window didn't have big flowers like that. Many thoughts lay deep in her heart, like garbage. All of them were made by life, squeezed out their juices, dried up their water, condensed into blocks, and couldn't rise above a certain level of excitement.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Understandably enough, Peace Lane at night offers up quite a picture; only, there is no large flower like the one on Wang Qiyao's curtain, and the flowers have sunk to the bottom so they do not drown out anything. These repressed thoughts float somewhere in the back of people's minds; when life throws everything against them, they squeeze the juice out, drain the water off, forming pictures of varying sizes and texture, but never able to rise above the stagnation.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: The night in the平安里 also contained many thoughts, but there was no big flower on the curtains of Wang Guo'er. It was just a reflection of it. Many thoughts were buried in their hearts, as if they were dried up like a dry sponge. They were all about making life tough, boiling down, purifying, condensing into blocks, how could they be touched up?
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Realized coming from a distance,平安里是有一个凌晨四点的光景的，但这些光景却笼罩着一切，抑或如一潭深不见底的咸菜色的浮云，心存芥蒂的都都都地咽下了，什么也没溢出。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: In the peaceful place there were also many thoughts at night, but they could not be seen because there was no big flowers on Wang Qiaoyue's curtains. Many of these thoughts were buried deep in her heart. They were just like garbage that had been squeezed dry. They all came from hard times and when you squeeze them out, they form a solid block. How can they rise up?
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): But even at night peace has many thoughts; only that the large flowers against Wang Qiyao's curtains cannot be seen give rise to countless others. These thoughts sink deep into one's heart, like garbage; it is the压力下榨出的精华，凝成的堡块，毫无波澜地。

chinese: 这种弄堂的房屋看上去是鳞次栉比，挤挤挨挨，灯光是如豆的一点一点，虽然微弱，却是稠密，一锅粥似的。
english: Apartment structures are built virtually on top of one another, cheek by jowl, breathing down upon each other's necks. Their lights are like tiny glowing peas, not very bright, but dense as a pot of pea porridge.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The courtyard house looks like a sea of brick, crowded together, with lights that seem like grains of sand. While weak, they were dense; as if a pot of soup.

The apartments of these longtang look like a series of parallel stripes, packed so densely that you have to zoom out to see anything beyond the first few or even the last few slivers. The lamps are clusterred, faintly路灯样的光，一直连成网状，什么事情都难以覆盖。
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: This kind of courtyard houses look like a row of buildings, crowded together, with dim lights here and there, although they are not bright, they form a dense soup.
The tactics of concealment work better in these longtang where every house looks to be built right next door; where lamps flicker in the darkness, contributing to an enveloping soup of light.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: This alley house appears to be a cluster of buildings, crowded together, with lights scattered like grains. Although faintly, they were dense, as if it was a soup pot.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: The shells of these longtang buildings look like a mesh of connection—crisscrossing toward each other, they seem to converge onto nothing at times, but however dense the mixture may be, you never can tell until you try.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: This alley house looks like a row of slum houses, crowded together, with dim lights that flicker like beans. Though weak, they form a dense mass.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Even so, these Shanghai-style longtang seem to be everywhere crowded; their buildings appear so close one might think they were built in the same batch. Despite the fact that they appear dim and distant, they actually exhibit a dense radiance—a bit of light in a soup of darkness.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: This courtyard flat is like a sea of bricks, crowded together, with lamps scattered like grains, although faintly, but dense.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): The apartments in these longtang look like a checkerboard of interlacing streets, requiring ample sunlight to spread out evenly.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: The houses in this lane look like a row of closely packed huts, with dim lights that flicker here and there, even though they're weak, they're dense and like a pot of soup.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): Despite their density, the longtang in the Shanghai of 1945 looked not crowded but spacious; even the flickering lights gave off a feeling of thickness, like a thick soup in which many small ingredients were simmering.

chinese: 薛蟠道：“要不是，我也不敢惊动：只因下月初三日，是我的生日，谁知老胡和老程他们，不知那里寻了来的：这么粗，这么长，粉脆的鲜藕；这么大的西瓜；这么长，这么大的暹罗国进贡的灵柏香熏的暹罗猪、鱼。
english: 'Look,' said Xue Pan. 'I wouldn't have troubled you otherwise, only it's my birthday on the third of next month and old Hu and old Cheng and a couple of the others, I don't know where they got them from but they've given me: a piece of fresh lotus root, ever so crisp and crunchy, as thick as that, look, and as long as that; a huge great melon, look, as big as that; a freshly-caught sturgeon as big as that; and a cypress-smoked Siamese sucking-pig as big as that that came in the tribute from Siam.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Then I would not have been surprised if they had not come to disturb me: for my birthday is on the 12th of this month; but how can I know that they did not come here? The length is so long, the texture is so fine, and the flavor is so sweet. There are a large, round fruit; a very big, round country; there are huge, round fish."

I hope you weren't aware that I was afraid of inviting you to my birthday dinner,' said Shi-Bao. 'I have no reason for expecting you to come, if it be to eat a bunch of ripe fish and a batch of hard candy, or a batch of powdered blue sugar on three, or a lengthwise long like tangrees, or so thick and such large like these Persian oranges as you've brought from Bao-chai's and Mr. Cheng's.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: Wang Zhepu said, "I wouldn't have done it if I hadn't been forced. It was on the thirtieth of this month that my birthday was. I didn't know that those two old men had come looking for me. They were so fat, so long, tender, fresh lotus roots; such a big watermelon; they were as long as these elephants' heads and as big as a whole elephant's head. And also there was the incense of the Elephant Country."

I wouldn't have bothered if it wasn't for the fact that it's my birthday,' said Xue Pan. 'I heard they were going to get some fresh coles from Old Hu and Old Cheng. And then I heard they'd brought this big bunch of Thai sugar cane sugar candy, and some of those long, fat Thai pigs and fish.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Peng Baogang said, "If it weren't for you, I wouldn't have disturbed you; because this month's birthday is my birthday: How big and how long are these? They're just as hard as a cucumber. A very small and short fresh pear. A huge pineapple, so large that it seems like an elephant. And a giant fish, so enormous that it looks like a lion."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I hope it's because,' said Xiang Pan, 'that you haven't forgotten me on this occasion. You would find out very soon what your friends have brought you: a big length of lightly spun pure jade-curd cake; a large bunch of long, thin plump pear cakes; a large bunch of the long, long mangoes from where your journeyman baker can find anything at bargain-price; some fragrant sweet corncake; and, above all, two long, tall chillies grown from the fruits of a new Government plantation in Thailand.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Wang Zhepan said: "I don't dare to disturb it unless I do so. Only because there were two old men here - one named Luo Hou and the other was called Cheng - they came up with this huge piece of fresh lotus root, such a big watermelon, and this giant elephant from Siam."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: I wouldn't have disturbed you if I hadn't been sure of your instant attention! It all starts on the thirteenth. Third Wednesday of the month. Now look: This beautiful fresh coconut pie! And look at the nice firm, ripe coconuts! And look at that lovely big pearl-white ear of暹逻王的 pork, so perfectly shaped and cut! And look at the crystal-clear fish from that far-off country called Thailand! Just wait until the twenty-first! That's the day I give my birthday feast.'
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct: Then I would not have been alarmed at all if it were not for my birthday; because on the 10th of next month is my birthday, and what can we say about our father-in-law and uncle-uncle? This is a large piece of raw ginger, this is a long piece of fresh fruit, this is a big piece of sweet melon; and this is a huge piece of a pineapple; and this is a huge piece of a fish."
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I hope it's because I've got a birthday,' said Bao-yu, 'that you wouldn't want to disturb me; but if there were only one thing on the month's calendar, which is the 3rd day after the New Year, I can imagine that by next week you should have procured from your backyard a root of about two feet thick and two feet long, with at each end ornamental buds, big enough for human hands to hold, and luscious florets of fresh cabbage, and enormous fruits of considerable age and quality supplied by the Chinguanians from Siam as far off as the Thai Islands.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct: Xuefeng said: "I wouldn't dare to disturb them if I didn't have to. Only on the thirtieth of this month, is my birthday. I had no idea where they found such big ones. The sweet fresh lotus roots; the huge watermelons; the long silkworms and fish from Siam."
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct(finetuned): I wouldn't have bothered if it hadn't been for the day on which they say it is,' said Xue Pan. 'It's Wednesday the third. Now, you know that my birthday falls on that day. You will remember that Uncle Huang and Uncle Cheng haven't got any meat in the house for a long time now. They might not have got any this week if it hadn't been for me! Look at the rough, hardy thing we've got! Look at the fresh, crisp sweetpotatoes the same size as my fist! And look at the big, long coconut curd balls, so cool and fragrant from the Thai Embassy ... just like those nice, kind pigs and fish they send us every year!

chinese: 为此她没少发牢骚，严先生枕头上也立下千般愿，万般誓，不料公私合营，产业都归了国家，能保住一处私房就是天恩地恩，花园洋房终成泡影。
english: In response to her complaints, he had, in bed, promised many times to move them to a house with a garden. Now that their assets were controlled by the government, they felt lucky simply to be allowed to keep their house.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: For her, she has not been silent about her grievances, while Mr. Chen's head was on the table as a hundred promises and vows were written for him. Yet, when he joined the state-owned enterprise, his properties became part of the national government, which meant that he had earned a heaven-sent blessing from heaven and earth. The dream of owning a private villa turned into a shadow at the garden apartment.

She didn't mind venting her frustrations, but Mr. Cheng had stricken out a million promises for the state and millions for the private pocket, and now their company was public property and they couldn't look back on their own fortunes—a beautiful garden and splendid apartment in their private mansion would have been worth more than anything.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: For this she had often complained, Mr. Yin had made a thousand vows on his pillow, all promises made, but when the public ownership of property was forced upon him, he could not retain even one room, and it was like a dream that the garden house had become a mere illusion.

She got upset enough to make Wang Qiyao swear that if he didn't give up his hobby, he'd offer the entire apartment to her—only to find that at the end of the day, state ownership meant the same thing as state blessing, and even if Madame Yan had won half of the property, it would have been a dead end.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: She had complained a lot about Mr. Chen's bedchamber and her promise of everything from heaven to earth, but it was not enough for her to have a private enterprise and all her property were handed over to the state. chinese: 他像喜鹊珍爱覆巢中最后一个卵一样珍爱着我父亲，但是，已经晚一点了，命运为他安排的更残酷的结局，已在前面路口上，胸有成竹地对他冷笑着。

She can read each word of every page, so half knows what they mean and half doesn't know anything. Half knew something but didn't know anything else. The water was boiling on the stove.

unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: She bought a newspaper at night when she was reading it. Each word of the paper she read aloud, so half of it was understood, but not all of it; there were half understanding, half misunderstanding between them. The water on the stove had opened up by now.

unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: She had a newspaper delivered at 5 o'clock in the evening and she read all its words slowly. She understood some of it but not much. Between understanding and misunderstanding, dinner time arrived. The water on the stove was boiling.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: She subscribed to a local newspaper and read it avidly, absorbing about half of what was printed and mulling over the other half, which arrived at dinner time having boiled over on the stove.

chinese: 陈清扬一出十五队我就看见了，白天未必能看这么远。

chinese: 那一条条一排排的里巷，流动着一些意料之外又清理之中的东西，东西不是什么大东西，但琐琐细细，聚沙也能成塔的。
english: Something is flowing through the longtang that is unpredictable yet entirely rational, small, not large, and trivial—but then even a castle can be made out of sand.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The streets that run through the town were filled with unexpected and cleaned-up items, but they weren’t big things. But the small stuff could be made into towers.

Inside these facades of blocks, some unexpected material is flowing mixed in with everything else; but even as the mixture shifts, one notices a few things that are not important: gossips about local merchants, fragments of old newspapers, remnants of wooden stakes for posts.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit-run: The alleys lined up with rows of houses were full of unexpected things that needed sorting out. They weren’t big but they added up to something.
The longtang flit with some unexpected goods and necessities; but even something as humblely insignificant as that can accumulate over time to form a tower.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: The streets were lined up one after another, with things that were unexpected but cleaned up. It was not a big thing, but it could be put together like sand for a tower.
unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Something unexpected intersects with something errant and dirty throughout these longtang—one of those places that needed cleaning cleanup: vague, silly little things like this gravel胡同, but not what they might be—a gathering place for people small and large, the sand between sand and grit enough to form a tower.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit: Those rows of lanes, flowing with some unexpected but cleaned things, things that were not big at all, but tiny details, like sand turning into a tower.
unsloth/Qwen2-1.5B-Instruct-bnb-4bit(fin: Through these longtang you pass by, carrying with her a collection of unexpected yet cleansing things. unsloth/Qwen2-0.5B-Instruct(finetuned): In these networks of longtang, things go about in a pattern oblivious to change but still connected: nothing big, nothing grand—but things, though unimaginably apart disconnected.
